item.description: { .img-fluid .mb-5} This version is built with Go 1.21.1 which contains some relevant security fixes for the html/template package, see Issue 62196 and Issue 62197. This is the main reason Hugo 0.119.0 is released sooner rather than later. But this release also comes with a dependency refresh and some useful image processing improvements: A new general-purpose Process method and filter. A new Opacity filter. Release Notes on GitHub.

item.title: How Was The Process of Building the Extension?
item.description: How Did You Build the Extension? Developing FocusTabs has been an enlightening journey filled with challenges, decisions, and ultimately, valuable lessons. In this post-mortem analysis, we’ll delve into the process, decisions made, mistakes encountered, and most importantly, the lessons learned throughout the development of the project. Decisions and Mistakes 1. item.title: What is Your Mission Statement?
item.description: What is Your Mission Statement? When you are working online, especially when trying to multitask, it is extremely easy to get lost in a sea of 30-40 tabs that leads you floundering. Indeed, cluttered tabs not only reduce your productivity but can also leave you more stressed and frustrated, as you struggle to keep track of everything. FocusTabs was built to address this issue, assisting the user with keeping track of all of the tabs needed to achieve each of their goals, and hence improving their overall virtual experience.

item.title: Who Built the Extension?
item.description: Who Built the Extension? FocusTabs was built as part of the curriculum for University of Pennsylvania’s CIS3500 class (“Software Design & Engineering”), instructed by Professor Jérémie O. Lumbroso, during the 2024 spring semester. Team FocusTabs was built by Anirudh Bharadwaj, Eshan Singhal, Guilherme Feitosa, and Kofi Addae-Sakyi – all undergraduate students at the University of Pennsylvania. Acknowledgements We would like to thank Professor Jérémie O. Lumbroso for his fundamental mentorship all throughout the development of FocusTabs.
